predicate.note: Frames file for 'date' based on sentences in wsj and automatic expansion via verbnet.

roleset.name: assign a calendar date

example.name: same thing, missing trace
example.text: The bills are dated Oct. 31 and mature Dec. 21, 1989.

example.name: date back to: separated
example.text: Federal credit programs date back to the New Deal, and were meant to break even financially.

example.name: date back to: joined
example.text: Mr. Seidman told the committee that the Resolution Trust Corp., the agency created to sell sick thrifts, has studied Lincoln's examination reports by former regulators dating back to 1986.
example.arg: Lincoln's examination reports by former regulators

example.name: passive: terminus post quem
example.text: Next month, NASA plans to launch a satellite to study cosmic rays dating from the birth of the universe.

example.name: with agent
example.text: John dated the contents of his fridge to the early 1960's.

roleset.note: Treebank gives an unbelievable range of syntaces for sentences containing 'date'. This should be a high priority for fixing, once we get the go-ahead to fix Tb.

example.name: as opposed to?
example.text: The book loses some momentum toward the end, when Lily becomes more preoccupied with *trace* dating boys and less with her delightfully weird family.
